inn1.comm: fullish outside off, angling away at a fairly gentle pace, left alone
a bit closer to the batsman now and he comes forward to play a checked drive to the left of mid-off
full again, a bit of shape into Stirling as he looks to play around his front pad. Misses it and it smacks him on the pad but it's going a long way down the leg side
overpitched on middle stump and Stirling simply leans over the ball to clip it away between short midwicket and mid-on
length ball, a bit of movement in from outside off. Stirling gets forward and defends into the on side
drifting into the pads once more and this time Stirling flicks it squarer, but the result is the same, four more, into the wide open space to the left of long leg
length ball, straightening a touch from a tight line close to off stump. Porterfield leaves, and it misses the top of off stump by not too much
this one's wider, easier leave for the left-hander
now he loses his line, starts outside leg stump and it swings even wider
length ball on a fourth stump line, leans forward and eases it to the right of mid-off
full outside off, punched to mid-off
full on off stump, straightens a touch, defends towards short extra cover
length ball outside off, blocked to short extra cover
back of a length on middle and off, defended towards mid-on
overpitched outside off, driven into the gap between short cover and mid-off. Chakabva chases back from mid-off to cut it off with a dive
fullish on the pads, clipped away to the right of midwicket
full on middle stump, defended with a straight bat to the left of short midwicket, who makes a diving stop
fullish on middle and leg, defended to short midwicket

short and wide, that shot was on, but he ended up slashing underneath the ball and hit it at catchable height to point, just over the head, and Williams takes it easily, with two hands, timing his jump just right
back of a length, angling away from off stump, left alone
fullish on middle and off, tucked away through backward square leg
back of a length on off stump, goes on the back foot to work it into the on side
back of a length outside off, left alone
full and wide, gets a big stride forward to drive to short cover
fullish on middle stump, looks to defend to mid-on, plays a little early, was in the air for a bit

fullish, slanting across, and Masakadza isn't sure if he's caught that cleanly. Poked forward to defend and didn't get close enough to the pitch. Edged it low towards first slip, who was falling to his left. They're checking with the third umpire if he's taken it cleanly or on the bounce. It's bounced just short of his fingers.
fullish on leg stump, tucked away into the gap between midwicket and mid-on
back of a length on off stump, defended towards short extra cover
back of a length on off stump, goes back and across to defend towards the bowler
fullish outside off, pushed with soft hands to the left of point
full outside off, and it doesn't come onto the bat as Joyce aims a drive through cover. Is into his shot too early and it skews off the inside half of his bat through square leg
yorker close to off stump, jabbed away towards third man
fullish, angling across, pretty close to off stump. Porterfield shoulders arms
length ball on off stump, defended towards mid-off
back of a length on leg stump, tucked away towards square leg
a touch shorter and he has a little more time to use his wrists to work it away wide of the square leg fielder, and place it to the right of long leg
low full-toss on off stump, punched back to the bowler
fullish on off stump, defended towards short cover
length ball on off stump, defended towards mid-off, short cover moves to his left to intercept
back of a length outside off, opens his bat face a little to push that to point
full, angling away from off stump, left alone
length ball outside off, not up there for the drive, doesn't come on either. Mistimes the flat-batted hit, rolls towards short cover
full-toss wide outside off, comes forward and reaches out to scoop it over cover point
back of a length outside off, poked away to third man
on the pads, clipped away between midwicket and mid-on
length ball angling towards off stump, blocked back to the bowler
fullish outside off, left alone
back of a length down the leg side, Joyce can't connect with the flick off the hips
fullish outside off, gets a good stride out to defend into the covers
full and wide and that's a lovely drive from Joyce, bat swishes through the line to send it arrowing through square cover
back of a length on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
fullish on off stump, defended down the ground towards mid-on
length ball angling in towards off stump, comes forward to drive through the off side, rolls off the inside edge towards mid-on
full outside off and Porterfield goes after it, slices underneath the ball to loft it over mid-off, doesn't connect cleanly at all. Bat turns in his hands
back of a length on off stump, defended back to the bowler
full on off stump, punched back to the bowler
full and wide, nicely timed drive, straight to cover point
length ball on middle and off, angling across. Defended to short extra cover
back of a length, down the leg side, glanced away neatly past the diving Taylor behind the stumps
full outside off, driven with an open face to the left of point
back of a length on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
full outside off, firm front-foot punch, straight to short cover
full outside off, defended close to Raza at short cover and they take him on and run the single. Joyce dives into the crease, Raza's throw misses the stumps
fullish, wider outside off this time, Porterfield pushes it towards Williams at cover point, they think of a single but decide against it
back of a length angling down leg, tucked away towards long leg
full on off stump, clipped towards short midwicket
fullish on middle stump, flicked to short midwicket
full and wide, and he drives that crisply, slapping it at the top of the bounce, but Zimbabwe have a sweeper cover in place for just that shot
back of a length on middle and off, defended towards short midwicket
shortish outside off, doesn't come on for the pull. Joyce chops it into his front pad
back of a length outside off, waits on it and steers it towards point
fullish on off stump. Joyce wants to push that towards mid-on, is too early into the shot, goes off the leading edge towards cover
back of a length outside off, guided to third man with an open face
full outside off, defended towards short extra cover
tossed up, angling in towards leg stump, clipped away through square leg
again angled in towards leg stump, flicked to short fine leg
tossed up, drifting in towards middle and leg, gets his front leg out of the way and smacks it firmly back to the bowler
tossed up on leg stump, driven down to long-on
again that leg stump line. Joyce gives himself room to drive to sweeper cover
a bit flatter, angling into the pads, whipped away through midwicket
back of a length, angling across, worked away from outside off, wide of mid-on
fullish outside off, driven to the left of sweeper cover
lovely length, angling across, inviting the drive. It isn't quite up there and he pushes at it away from his body, and the ball leaves him just a touch to beat his outside edge
back of a length outside off, steered away to third man
length ball close to off stump, left alone
back of a length outside off, pushed into the covers
tossed up, a bit of drift in towards middle stump, was shaping to drive through cover, could only push it back to the bowler
pushed through a bit quicker and shorter, goes through with the angle to beat the attempted cut
back of a length again, punched to short cover
fuller now, flat-batted down to long-off
full-toss on the pads, pushed to short midwicket
makes room to cut, a dangerous shot because it wasn't particularly short and was going with the angle towards off stump, but he manages to force it past point, towards sweeper cover
length ball outside off, chopped to short third man
short ball outside off, miscues the pull, ends up hitting it in the air over wide mid-on. Chatara, chasing back, can't reach it
length ball angling across, presses forward to defend towards point
length ball on middle stump, worked away wide of mid-on
back of a length on off stump, punched down the ground towards mid-off
length ball on off stump, defended towards short extra cover
down the track now, worked off the toes through square leg
length ball outside off, driven down to long-off
another one slides on with the angle towards middle stump, makes room and pokes it off the front foot into the covers
down the track, doesn't quite reach the pitch, swipes it away from middle stump towards deep midwicket
sees him stepping out and bowls a full-toss near his front foot, poked to short midwicket
down the track, clipped away to long-on
full outside off, and that's a good-looking chipped hit down the ground, between the non-striker and mid-off
length ball outside off, dabbed down to third man
slower ball on off stump, lets it come on and dabs it to backward point
back of a length on off stump, punched to point
full and wide, goes for the drive, doesn't get his head over it, slices it high in the air, drops down short of third man
length ball outside off, dabbed to backward point
back of a length, angling across, slapped away through square cover
length ball on off stump, punched to short midwicket
goes for the reverse-sweep, through the shot too early, ball hits his glove and then his helmet
tossed up on middle and leg, drilled back to the bowler
down the leg side, worked away towards fine leg
length ball on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
back of a length outside off, pokes at it with an open face, looking to dab to third man, can't get any bat on it
slower ball, slips it down the leg side

short outside off, and Mupariwa has dropped it. Went for the pull, had to drag it from way outside off, ended up spooning it high towards square leg. The bowler chased after it, got both hands to it, couldn't hold on
length ball outside off, shuffles across to defend towards point
back of a length on off stump, worked away towards mid-on
fullish outside off, left alone
gone. Porterfield's agonising innings comes to an end. Williams fires it across the left-hander, who makes room and tries to hit it over extra cover. Ends up scooping a high, simple catch to mid-off
tossed up, angling across towards off stump, presses forward to defend towards point
back of a length on leg stump, makes room to push it with the angle to short cover
tossed up on middle stump, worked away towards long leg
tossed up on off stump, and that is a gorgeous shot from Balbirnie. Simply gets his front foot out of the way and leans his weight into a gentle push, sends it racing away through cover
back of a length on middle stump, blocked back to the bowler
back of a length outside off, drags that pull down to long-on
length ball outside off, steered away towards point
back of a length on off stump, defended back to the bowler
length ball on off stump, defended towards mid-on
back of a length outside off, chopped down to third man
length ball outside off, dabbed away to third man
not short enough to cut, and it also keeps low outside off, and he almost chops it onto his stumps, inside-edges into the keeper's pads
length ball outside off, comes forward to poke it towards point
tossed up on off stump, driven down to long-off

makes a lot of room, exposes all his stumps, and that is super placement. There was a sweeper on the off-side boundary, but he slapped away this length ball on off stump and placed it a large distance to the fielder's left
length ball on the pads, worked away through square leg
tossed up, goes with the angle towards off and middle, defended back to the bowler
back of a length on middle and leg, defended back to the bowler
length ball outside off, gets his head over to chop it away towards third man
back of a length outside off, slapped away to sweeper cover
full on middle and off, pushed back to the bowler

length ball, some width outside off, and he slices it in the air, to the right of backward point and to the left of third man, Panyangara, who gets into a massive tangle while making the sliding stop and looking to avoid touching the ball at the same time when his foot is touching the boundary cushions, doesn't quite manage to do so
full on leg stump, clipped away through square leg
down the track, and that's a cracking shot from Joyce. Moved inside the line, and both his arms came through at full extension to smack that over the bowler's head
back of a length on the pads, tucked away through square leg
comes forward to defend, goes with the angle and off the inside edge, into the leg side
down the track, driven down to long-off
tossed up on leg stump, down the track and pushed to long-on
back of a length on off stump, skips inside the line and punches it towards deep point
floated across, defended towards short cover
back of a length on off stump, punched back to the bowler
tossed up down the leg side, clipped away to deep midwicket
short on off stump and Joyce rocks back in a flash and clears his front leg to swivel through the hips and pull it over the midwicket boundary
down the track now, and Raza follows him with a full ball at his feet, blocked back towards the bowler
down the track again, driven down to long-on
length ball on leg stump, paddled away towards fine leg
back of a length on off stump, punched back to the bowler
tossed up, angling in towards middle and leg, and that is an excellent shot from Balbirnie, knew there was a gap at deep square leg, and cleared his front leg to sweep it firmly in that direction
full on off stump, defended towards extra cover
back of a length outside off, dabbed away towards third man

flat, round-arm, angling in towards middle and leg, pushed down the ground towards long-off. Ooh, hang on, the bowler dived to his left, and that was in the air, and he did get his left hand to it, so that could count as a drop
tossed up outside off, drives well, can't beat cover point, diving to his right
length ball on the pads, tucked away to square leg
length ball down the leg side, tucked away to backward square leg
down the track, looks for the drive down the ground, can't beat short midwicket
on the pads, clipped away to deep square leg
back of a length on middle stump, pushed down the ground to long-on
length ball wide outside off, makes a bit of room and carves it away over cover point. And Panyangara has overstepped as well
and he bowls Joyce with a middle-stump yorker as he slogs and misses
back of a length outside off, dabbed down to third man
length ball wide outside off, goes forward to drive and has to check himself after it stops on the pitch, pops it in the air, bounces down to sweeper cover
length ball outside off, nice-looking on-the-up punch to short cover
fullish outside off, comes forward to poke it to the right of point
length ball, angling in. Looks for the push through cover, inside-edges it into the leg side

and here's Joyce! That's short, and Joyce pulls it away over the midwicket boundary, and it's gone over the fence at the back of the grass banks. Pulled it off the front foot, made no effort to keep it down, and timed it so, so sweetly
full on middle and leg, clipped away towards long leg
short and wide, slapped away to sweeper cover
on the pads now, tucked away to long leg
length ball angling in towards off stump, defended towards short midwicket
back of a length outside off, poked away to point
tossed up on leg and middle, defended back to the bowler
down the track now, driven down to long-off
shortish, down the leg side, worked away towards deep backward square leg
down the track, fired in towards middle and off, defended back to the bowler
length ball on leg stump, backs away and slaps it to sweeper cover
length ball, floated across outside off, flat-batted to sweeper cover
length ball on middle stump, and he stretches forward to lap it very fine, over the keeper's left shoulder
shortish outside off, slapped away to the left of sweeper cover
full outside off, presses forward to drive towards sweeper cover
full on leg stump, clipped away towards deep square leg
length ball outside off, chopped away towards backward point
full down leg, can't connect with the flick, hits his pad and rolls into the leg side
length ball outside off, punched to short extra cover
length ball wide outside off, slapped to sweeper cover
back of a length on middle stump, makes room, slapped away towards deep point
back of a length on leg stump, tucked away through square leg
down the track, clipped away towards short fine leg
flat, round arm, angled into the pads, flicked away to deep backward square leg
length ball on off stump, pushed down the ground to long-off
appeal for lbw as he hits him on the front pad on the half-volley as he shapes to reverse-sweep. Was struck outside the line, I think
tossed up outside off, flat-batted towards deep point
length ball on the pads, clipped to square leg
length ball down the leg side, swept to long leg
down the track, whips this from outside off towards wide long-on
ooh. That was floated across the batsman, who made room to drive and didn't get to the pitch, scooped it in the air, and it fell just short of the short cover fielder, diving forward
short ball, pulled away easily to the midwicket boundary
flat, fired in down leg, swept away to deep square leg
short, down the leg side, Joyce can't bring his bat around quickly enough to pull it fine
flat, short and wide, cut away to deep point
full on the pads, clipped to short fine leg
back of a length outside off, slower ball. Looks to prod it away through point, doesn't connect
full outside off, goes after it and slices it away over backward point. Both point and third man were inside the circle
full outside off, driven to sweeper cover
back of a length on the pads, tucked away through square leg
length ball outside off, pushed off the back foot to sweeper cover
length ball outside off, slapped hard to backward point
length ball outside off, steered to deep point
shortish on off stump, pulled in the air towards deep midwicket

short again, and he pulls it away to the left of deep midwicket to bring up a superb century. Struggled with the slow pace of the pitch early on, but he's grown increasingly fluent, and he's reached the landmark in 96 balls.
full-toss on off stump, poor ball, makes room and lifts it over cover
full on leg stump, clipped away through backward square leg
length ball outside off, and that's timed away very well, square drive to the left of sweeper cover
down the track now, a bit of air outside off, can't beat extra cover with that drive

dropped! Craig Ervine, what have you done? He made room for the lofted extra cover drive, got no elevation, and it was catchable, at chest height, and he simply couldn't hold on. Got his hands into a real tangle
down the track, driven to long-on

excellent attempt from Mire at the deep midwicket boundary, diving to his left and reaching overhead, but he could only get the fingertips of his left hand to it as Balbirnie slog-sweeps this middle-stump ball powerfully over the top
fullish on leg stump, clipped through midwicket
down the track comes Joyce, Raza fires it into his feet, and he whips it away over the wide long-on boundary. Did very well to get his foot out of the way and make room to swing through the shot
full outside off, makes room and scoops it over wide mid-off
full and wide, makes a bit of room to slice that lofted drive to the left of sweeper cover
slower full-toss outside off, swiped away to deep midwicket
gone. Another slower full-toss, and Joyce cleared his front leg to hit it over mid-on, maybe, ended up toe-ending it and popping the simplest of catches to short midwicket
bouncer outside off, left alone
another bouncer, angling into the body, goes for the hook, doesn't time it, in the air for a bit before rolling slowly down to deep square leg
length ball on off stump, looked like the slower one, defended to short extra cover
full, angling down leg. Doesn't come on at all as Kevin looks to flick, hits him on the front pad
fullish outside off, a bit of swinging room for the first time, and Kevin clears his front leg and launches it powerfully over mid-off

dropped! The substitute fielder at short cover, Matsikenyero, had to dive forward and take it low, but he got both hands to it, and it popped out as he landed. Kev was too early into his drive, the ball stopped on him
full on leg stump, clipped down to long-on
length ball on off stump, poked to short cover
length ball, fired in towards middle and leg, poked away into the leg side
looks to cramp Kev for room, fires it down the leg side
length ball on middle stump, doesn't come on as he looks to clip through the leg side. Pops in the air to the right of the bowler
full on leg stump, gets his foot out of the way and punches it down the ground to long-off
length ball angling in towards middle stump, worked away to deep midwicket
fullish on middle stump, pushed down to long-on
boom. That's fullish, angled into off stump, and he clears his front leg and slog-sweeps it over deep midwicket, clears the ropes easily
tossed up outside off, pushed to short cover. Called Balbirnie for the single, sent him back, but he's back in his crease by the time Chibhabha underarms it to the bowler
flat, back of a length, on off stump, poked to short cover
length ball down the leg side, lapped over short fine leg
down the track now, gets inside the line, and that is smacked so powerfully, over the bowler's head, and long-on had no chance of cutting that off running to his left
sees him make room, bowls it close to his front leg, and he moves it away to slice it towards point
full, attacking the batsman's feet, clipped to short fine leg
fullish on leg stump. Clears his front leg and looks to heave it over the leg side, inside-edges it past his leg stump, down to the fine leg boundary
middle-stump yorker, jams his bat down on it, hits the base of his bat, bounces over the stumps, through to the keeper
slower ball angled away outside off, and he uses the swinging room to shovel it over the bowler's head, carries all the way
slower ball wide outside off, has to reach out to slap that through the off side, gets nowhere near connecting
full-toss on middle stump, and he simply plays a short-arm jab across the line to lift that over the square leg boundary. Super shot.
full and wide, almost a yorker. Balbirnie throws his bat at it but can't connect
full outside off, and that's an excellent shot, jabs down on it with an open-faced bat to squirt it away to the right of short third man
full-toss, angling down leg, poor ball, just helps it away to the left of short fine leg
yorker outside off, jams down on it and that's a good stop from point, diving to his left
slower ball on middle and leg, makes room to poke it to mid-off
in the blockhole on leg stump, gets his feet out of the way and smacks it to long-off
makes room and he follows him with a full ball, still has enough room to chip it away over the leaping cover fielder
very full on leg stump, jabbed away to cover point
waist-high full-toss on leg stump, pulled away to the backward square leg boundary. Terrible way to start the over
slower ball wide outside off, and Kev goes for the big hit, only succeeds in skewing it high in the air, simple catch to the man at long-on
oh my. What was he trying to do there? Ends up bowling a wide way outside the off stump, beyond the return crease
in the blockhole on off and middle, squeezed away towards point
slower ball wide outside off. Balbirnie goes after it, looking to drive, can't connect
looks to make room, Chatara follows him with the full ball, drives it down to long-on
slower ball, back of a length, nipping in towards off stump, dabbed down to third man
back of a length, straightens on off stump and beats Wilson's attempt to dab it to third man. Looked like the legcutter. Taylor, standing up, couldn't collect cleanly
shortish on off stump, and that's chopped away very smartly, made a little bit of room and hit it to the left of cover point
fullish outside off, stretches out to lap it to short fine leg
full slower ball on leg stump, clears his front leg and swipes it to square leg
length ball outside off, driven crisply to the right of sweeper cover
slower ball, full on off stump, poked back to the bowler
slower ball wide outside off, reaches out to drive, it's too wide to make contact
dipping full-toss on leg stump, misses the across-the-line swipe, rolls into the leg side off the pad
shortish slower ball outside off, makes room and waits a long, long time before slapping it away between backward point and short third man
full on middle and leg, clipped away towards deep midwicket
yorker on off stump, jabbed away to extra cover
full on middle stump and that's a super shot from Wilson, just a pick-up whip that carries all the way over the square leg boundary
length ball on off stump, makes a bit of room to push with soft hands towards point
sees him making room and follows him, and Wilson adjusts quickly to sweep it away firmly to the backward square leg boundary

got him. The previous shot brought about a field change, with square leg going back and the off-side sweeper coming in to cover point. Wilson made room to slap the full ball over the fielder, didn't get elevation, and he timed his jump well to take a good overhead catch
full and wide, flat-batted to the right of long-off
tossed up on leg stump and Mooney clears his front leg to swipe it away towards deep square leg
flat, fired in towards off stump, and he adjusts his hands to reverse-slap it over point
full and straight, you miss, I hit. Crashed into middle and leg as Mooney cleared his front leg to slog-sweep over the leg side
tossed up on off stump, driven down to long-off
back of a length on middle and off, dabbed away with the angle towards backward point
full, angling across. Balbirnie smacks it hard over the off side, almost carries all the way to sweeper cover
slower ball, angled across. Looks to stay leg side of the ball and dab it away with an open face, doesn't make contact

well bowled. Sees him come down the track, making room, and bowls a quick bouncer, across the batsman. He takes his eyes off the ball momentarily, is caught between pulling and uppercutting, and ends up top-edging a simple catch to third man
full outside off, sliced away to sweeper cover
slower ball on off stump, makes room and looks to hit over the top, doesn't quite time it, but clears mid-off fairly comfortably

yorker on middle stump, makes room to squeeze it away towards sweeper cover. They take on Chakabva's arm and go for a second, the throw is accurate, and Taylor is quick to remove the bails before Balbirnie could dive into his crease, and the square leg umpire had no hesitation in raising his finger, didn't need to go to the third umpire. Sad end to a superb innings.
low full-toss outside off, slower-ball, flat-batted to long-off
slower ball outside off, goes after it, hits it high in the air, Williams, running in a long way from the rope at long-off, can't get to it
slower yorker on off stump, makes room and pokes it into the covers
another slower ball outside off. Cusack didn't know much about it, ended up getting beaten trying to run it down to third man
yorker outside off, drags it away into the on side, and they get a single before the bowler can field it in his follow through

inn2.comm: good length ball outside off, he spars at it and gets beaten
fuller and outside off, much better judgement from Chibhabha as he leaves it alone
back of a length and swinging away outside off, he looks to punch and gets beaten
pitched up and outside off, driven to the covers
shortish and on off, Chibhabha fends it carefully
back of a length and outside off, he camps on the back foot and cuts it away behind point. The man at third man runs across and keeps it to two
dug in short and outside off, dabbed wide of slip
banged in short, pulled away to deep backward square leg
fuller and angled just outside off from wide of the crease, he pushes at it with not much footwork and gets beaten
beaten again. On a good length and outside off, he drives with his feet paralysed to the crease and watches the ball zip past the outside edge
back of a length and just outside off, the batsman was in a dilemma whether to play of leave it. He is late to withdraw his bat as the ball dribbles to point
pitched up and on the fourth stump line, driven straight to mid-off, Not all that well-timed though
back of a length and outside off, he dabs it towards point
veering onto the pads, Raza flicks it to the man at midwicket
back of a length and outside off, Raza aims to force it through the off side, but only tamely pushes it to the covers
pitched further up and nipping away outside off, Raza lets it be
good length ball homing in on off, tapped to point
back of a length and on the off stump, Raza seeks to punch it away, but does not get hold of it. The ball drops onto the pitch
fuller and in the channel outside off, patted to the covers
he gets behind this good length ball on off and defends it to the off side
pitched up and outside off, he shelves the drive and leaves it alone
pitched further up and just outside off, he comes forward and drives it sweetly, beating the dive of the man at mid-on. That raises the first boundary of Zimbabwe's innings
slanting down leg, Chibhabha does not bother with it and it is deemed a wide
good length ball on the fourth-stump line, he closes his bat face early and gets a leading edge that pops in front of point
dropped short and outside off, he cashes in his cheque and cuts it fiercely behind point. The ball races away
drifting onto the hips, milked past square leg for a single
back of a length and just a smidge outside off, he goes back and across to block it
on a good length and on off, tentatively defended in front of point
very full and straight, Chibhabha hangs back and tucks it wide of square leg
fuller and outside off, Raza lets it pass
short and width on offer as well, Taylor rocks back and nails the pull between mid-on and midwicket
good length ball around off, he lifts it over the non-striker for a four. The man at mid-on had no chance of stopping the four
teasing full ball outside off, Chibhabha shoulders arms
straighter in line, he shuffles across and flicks it down to long leg
Raza fetches this short ball from outside off and pulls it away to the deep midwicket boundary. This is a busy start from Zimbabwe
fullish one outside off, ignored by Raza
another probing full ball outside off, Raza is still not interested
banged in short and down leg. Chibhabha ducks under easily and the umpire calls it a wide
straighter in line now, turned to midwicket
pitched up and outside off, Chibhabha does not want any of it
back of a length and outside off, he looks for a cut and flashes it onto the ground, the ball goes over point
fullish one just outside off, he loads up for a drive, but has to settle with a thick inside edge to the leg side
fuller and on middle and leg, bunted to mid-on
good length ball on off, Chibhabha is squared up a touch, but manages to poke it out to the covers
seeing the batsman run down the track, Mooney drags his length back. He adjusts and punches it to the man at point
very full and on off, mistimed drive back to the bowler, who dives in his followthrough to stop the ball
picked away off the pads behind square on the leg side
Raza opens the face of his bat on impact with this good length ball outside off and dabs it to point

Mooney strikes. Raza is gone. This was full and swinging away outside off, Raza throws his bat at a drive, the ball catches the outside edge and flies to slip, where Stirling dives sharply to his left to snag the ball
fuller and outside off, Mire lets it pass
he bangs in a bouncer, Chibhabha sinks under it
pitched up, the line is on off, defended to the covers
good length delivery on off, defended tentatively to the covers

That's a skier and William Porterfield pulls off a smart catch, Cusack exults. Both the Zimbabwe openers are back in the hut. Chibhabha comes down the track, manufactures a length back and looks to launch it over the covers. But he can only skew it up in the air. Porterfield tracks back from point and completes a fine catch
fullish and around off, dabbed to point
similar line and length, defended to point. That rounds off a wicket-maiden
flicked through square leg for a couple
pitched up and outside off, left alone
back of a length and outside off, he stays back and defensively pushes it towards the covers
back of a length and outside off, he stands tall and punches it past mid-off. The fielder runs back, relays a throw to keep it to three
pitched up and on middle, Mire drills a straight drive, the ball runs away to the boundary. Mooney kicks the turf in disgust
Mooney drags his length back outside off, Mire punches it to the covers
back of a length and outside off, he stands tall and punches it to the covers
similar length and outside off, cut strongly but Hami M can't beat Porterfield at point

KOB goes up for a caught behind appeal. The umpire raises his finger. Has Hamilton Masakadza nicked off? He does not opt for the review and trudges back. Fuller and outside off, he pushes at it, the ball may have slipped off an outside edge to the keeper. Yes, Snicko picks up a spike, vindicating the umpire's decision
fuller and outside off again, left lone
fuller and straighter, clipped wide of mid-on for a single
banged in short and outside off, mis-controlled pull past midwicket
tossed up nicely outside off, driven down to long-off
full and outside off, driven to long-off again
and again. Hanging in the air, the batsman gets an easy single to long-off
dropped shortish and outside off, mistimed cut to the covers
much quicker and on off, blocked back to the bowler
fired flat and quick on off, jammed back to the bowler, who moves to his left to stop the ball
crunched. This was not a half volley. Good length ball outside off, he props forward and drives it through mid-off
back of a length and on middle and leg, defended to the leg side
fullish and around off, Taylor drops it to the covers and looks for a quick single. But he has to settle with a dot
Taylor dabs this good length ball outside off to point
KOB drags his length back outside off, tapped to point
pitched up and on the fourth stump, Taylor shuffles across and pootles a lovely flick past mid-on, who chases the ball in vain
looped up on off, pushed to the covers
shortish and just outside off, punched off the back foot to mid-off
pushed through quicker and shorter outside off, he brings out a short-arm-pull to long-on
Dockrell gives this more air outside off, he flows forward and drives it past the covers
straight roller on off, blocked in front of the bowler
fuller and straighter, Taylor nudges it to midwicket
good length ball outside off, Taylor lifts it over mid-on for a boundary. He moves onto 18
mighty full dips in on off, the batsman adjusts and knocks it back to the bowler, who dives in his followthrough to stop the ball
Taylor knows that mid-off is up and cashes in. Good length ball outside off, Taylor just launches it over mid-off and reaps reward for awareness of the field
back of a length and outside off, dabbed to point
fuller and around off, Taylor invests in a drop-and-run single in front of point
back of a length and on off, Mire wants to flick it to the leg side, but reins in his impulse and ends up patting it back to the bowler
floated up nicely, nudged behind square on the leg side
shortish and quicker outside off, slapped away to long-on
straighter in line, Taylor ventures deep in his crease and clips it backward of square leg

dropped and KOB is the culprit at the covers. This was tossed up outside off, Mire drills a forceful drive. Kevin O'Brien can't hang on to it. It was hit at the rate of knots and KOB now examines his hand
worked to the leg side for a single
dropped short and just outside off, punched towards long off
flighted delivery on off, defended back to the bowler
flatter and fired outside off, punched to point
straight roller on middle, defended carefully

gottim. Zimbabwe slump to 74 for 4. This was a bit short and outside off, accompanied by some extra bounce, which foils Mire's timing. Mire does not get hold of the cut and picks out Cusack at backward point
shortish outside off, slapped away towards deep point
tossed up outside off, looks for the drive down to long-on, short midwicket dives to intercept
fullish, angled into the pads, tucked away through square leg
back of a length, goes through with the angle to cramp him for room, punched back to the bowler
fuller now, comes forward to clip to short midwicket
tossed up on off stump, driven down the ground to long-off
slow flight outside off. Taylor sticks his front foot across and tucks it away with the turn through square leg
down the track, doesn't quite get to the pitch, goes with the angle as he looks to defend and he inside-edges into his front pad
tossed up outside off, comes forward, meets it on the full, clips it away to long-on
length ball on off stump, clipped to long-on
angles this into the pads, and he nurdles it to backward square leg
length ball outside off, comes forward to push it into the covers, keeps going with the arm and it hits his inside edge and rolls into the leg side
fuller now, and he leans over the ball to clip it to long-on
short and wide, punched away to the right of sweeper cover
length ball, angling into the pads, whipped away to deep midwicket
not full enough to drive, but he plants his front foot out to this ball outside off, and punches with the turn towards short midwicket
length ball on off stump, punched back to the bowler
a touch shorter, pulled away towards deep midwicket
tossed up on off stump, Taylor swipes it away to the right of long-on
flighted delivery, wider outside off than the previous one, and Taylor uses the swinging room to slog-sweep powerfully over cow corner, ball smacks into the boundary hoardings on the full
length ball outside off, driven towards short extra cover
a bit slower and he gets forward to work it away with the turn towards deep midwicket
length ball outside off, pushed through a bit quicker, defended to short cover
goes for a slog-sweep from way outside off stump, pops it up off the toe-end of  the bat, over the non-striker's head
down the track now, and he swings it away with the spin, powerfully over midwicket
tossed up outside off, left alone
flighted outside off, stretches out to lap it away towards fine leg
tossed up, angling in towards leg stump. Williams knows the field is in behind square on the off side, and plays a powerful reverse-sweep through backward point
length ball outside off, defended to extra cover
down the track, McBrine follows him, spears it full at his feet, clipped towards short fine leg
full on middle stump, punched back towards the bowler
back of a length outside off, punched down the ground to long-on
tossed up outside off, driven down to long-on
flighted ball, angled in towards off stump, presses forward to clip it towards deep midwicket
length ball on middle and off, punched down the ground to long-on
comes out to sweep again, this one's a touch too full, but he manages to drag it away towards fine leg
length ball on off stump, driven down to long-off
speared in towards the pads, a bit of extra bounce and he can't connect with the flick. Hits him on the flap of the pad and pops into the leg side
back of a length on off stump, chopped away towards deep point

short outside off, and that didn't turn, so he had to drag this pull from a long way outside off, but he manages to hit it with extreme power to the wide long-on boundary. Taylor points to the umpire that there are more than four fielders outside the circle, and that is indeed the case, and it's a no-ball.
fullish on off stump, clipped through square leg
length ball, angling into middle stump, punched down the ground to long-on
a bit of flight outside off, leans forward to clip it to long-on
full outside off, driven to long-off
full and flat down the leg side, clipped away towards fine leg
premeditated the sweep from way outside off, was a touch shorter than he would have liked, and he merely placed his bat out in front of him, at an angle, to lap it just wide of the keeper
sees him stepping out of his crease and spears it flatter, into his pads, knocked to short midwicket
goes for the drive over cover and the ball stops on him. Checks his shot and chips it over the top, drops down safely short of long-off
length ball outside off, presses forward to defend wide of short extra cover
down the track and he shortens his length a touch. Williams whips it away towards deep backward square leg
slow full-toss on the pads, clipped away towards deep square leg
full, angling in towards off stump, defended to short extra cover
back of a length, angling into off stump, worked away to deep square leg
fullish, angled across, Williams leaves it alone
fuller now and he gets forward to drive to extra cover
full on off stump, driven to long-off
low full-toss outside off, clipped to straight midwicket
starts his spell with a long-hop outside off and Williams is too good a puller, puts it away easily to the square leg boundary
back of a length outside off, punched to long-off

full, angling in. Taylor comes forward to sweep, misses, rolls off the front  pad towards short fine leg. O'Brien appeals, not given. Must have been going down leg. Replays show it hit his glove first. The umpire didn't spot that
back of a length slower ball outside off, slapped to sweeper cover
in the blockhole on middle and leg, jabbed away to extra cover
low full-toss outside off and that's a super shot, gets under it and scoops it over extra cover, into the wide open space to the left of the long-off fielder
back of a length outside off, punched down to long-off
full on off stump, Taylor plonks his front leg across and plays around it to clip it to deep square leg
back of a length outside off, punched to the right of short extra cover
shortish, angling down leg, and he paddles it away, just helps it away, into the gap to the right of short fine leg
length ball on off stump, defended towards short extra cover
in the blockhole on off stump, Taylor looks to play through the on side, adjusts at the last moment to poke it into the covers. May have swung away at the last moment
length ball angling into middle stump, shuffles across to tuck it away towards short midwicket

oh my. He came down the track, looking to make room to hit over the covers, and the legcutter from Kev made him slice it towards short third man. The ball bounced and turned away from the fielder, Mooney, wrong-footing him
length ball on middle and leg, swiped away towards deep square leg
back of a length, angling into Williams, who works it off his hips to short fine leg
length ball on off stump, makes room to dab it towards backward point
full, angling down leg. Misses the flick and it bounces off his pad into the off side
comes down the track to work it away through the on side. The ball goes with the angle and hits him on the front pad
tossed up on off stump, defended back to the bowler
shortish on off stump, clubbed down to long-on
tossed up on off and middle, stretches forward to lap it away towards fine leg
a bit quicker now, angling into off stump and turning towards middle. Looks to tuck it away to fine leg but plays it too close to the keeper
a bit of flight now, outside off. Presses forward to tuck it into the leg side
full, angling down leg, looks to sweep, rolls off the back leg towards fine leg

shortish, angling down leg, pulled away towards deep backward square leg. Cusack had a lot of ground to cover to his left on the boundary, and he saved it with a slide. Just about managed to keep his foot away from the rope
low full-toss on off stump, pushed down the ground to long-on
back of a length on middle and leg. Makes room to cut, can't beat point
sees him making room and angles this down leg. Looks to poke it into the covers, inside-edges it to deep square leg
low full-toss on off stump, punched back to the bowler
down the track, gets to the pitch of it. Mid-off's in the circle and he lofts it over that fielder, using his wrists to get leverage
full on off stump, clipped to the left of short midwicket, where Porterfield makes a diving stop
full on off stump, whipped down to long-on to bring up the 100 partnership
tossed up outside off, swept away towards the straight midwicket boundary
down the track now, doesn't get to the pitch, defends towards extra cover
a bit more air, on off stump, clears his front leg and sweeps powerfully to the square leg boundary
slides this down the leg side and Taylor brings his bat around his front pad, to sweep very fine, and short fine leg does a good job chasing back to cut it off near the rope
down the track, he drags his length back a bit, swipes it to short midwicket
short outside off, pulled to deep midwicket
tossed up outside off, goes with the angle, presses forward to defend towards short cover
nice loop outside off, doesn't get to the pitch to drive, plays a checked drive to short cover
comes forward again, but lets it come on this time, looks for the dabbed single to short third man, doesn't get it
tossed up outside off, swept to deep square leg

slow loopy ball outside off and he frees his arms to launch it over long-on. Mooney, running to his left, makes a spectacular effort at the boundary, but the ball missed his left hand by a decent distance
now he gives him a bit of room outside off and he comes forward, his front foot inside the line, and lifts this drive over mid-off. Beautiful shot
down the track now, Stirling bowls it a bit quicker, forces him to defend to short cover
goes for the sweep from middle stump, top-edges it over the keeper. Short fine leg runs back to field it
tossed up outside off, steps forward to push it to long-on
length ball outside off, presses forward to block it back to the bowler
back of a length outside off, punched to short extra cover
tossed up outside off, presses forward and clips it away towards short fine leg to bring up his seventh ODI hundred, equalling Alistair Campbell's Zimbabwe record. This has been a stupendous effort
tossed up on off stump, driven to long-on
length ball on off stump, plonks forward to clip to short midwicket

looks for the paddle sweep from wide outside off, too wide to make any contact. Or has he made contact? Keeper appeals for caught behind. Not given. They take a looong time before deciding to review, they've gone for it. Nope. No bat, as far as I can tell. May have hit the right forearm. Snicko shows nothing. Not out.
length ball outside off, slapped to backward point
back of a length outside off, punched to point
fuller now, drives, can't beat short extra cover
length ball outside off, this time he finds the gap, pokes it away to sweeper cover
shot. That's full on off stump, and he moves away from the line to chip that over extra cover
very full outside off, plants his front foot across to lap-sweep towards square leg
down the track first ball, and that is a beautiful whip over wide long-on. Six off the first ball, immediate pressure on Ireland
tossed up outside off, driven inside out to the right of sweeper cover
length ball, a bit of turn away from off stump, works it to short midwicket
down the track, pulls his length back a bit, defended back to the bowler
down the track again, and that was struck so sweetly. This was outside off, and he flat-batted it firmly over long-on
tossed up outside off, and he steps forward and across to whip it against the turn once more, over wide mid-on, and it rolls away into the vacant boundary
back of a length on off stump, pulled away towards deep midwicket, and that's Williams' fifty
makes room and he bowls a yorker outside off, jabbed away into the covers

uh, oh. Taylor's gone. Big, big moment, this. This was full outside off. Taylor was looking to lift it over cover. It was the slower one, he was through his shot too early, and the bat turned in his hands and it looped to mid-on instead
length ball on middle stump, tucked away into the vacant short midwicket region
short ball outside leg, can't connect with the pull
back of a length outside off. Ervine slashes and misses
boom. That was a short ball, angling into his body. There was a man back at deep midwicket but Williams clears him easily with the pull
full outside off, driven firmly to mid-off, Niall O'Brien fumbles, allowing the batsmen to complete an easy single
length ball on off stump, defended to short extra cover
length ball on off stump, looks for the dabbed single to point, too close to the fielder
bouncer, angling into the body. Doesn't control the pull, pops it high in the air, but it drops down well short of Mooney running in from deep midwicket
fullish on middle and off, swiped away to deep midwicket
short outside off, pulled away to deep midwicket
full and wide, driven crisply but Kevin O'Brien at extra cover moves quickly to his right to stop it
fullish on off stump, pushed down the ground to mid-off. This time Mooney is the fumbler
length ball on off stump, driven to extra cover
length ball outside off, looked like the slower one. Ervine let it come on and guided it to third man
full on middle stump, whipped away through the leg side, excellent placement between deep midwicket and wide mid-on
length ball on middle and off, clipped away through midwicket
sees him coming down the track, bowls it shorter, slugged away to deep midwicket
full on off stump, clears his front leg to smack it down to long-off
short ball outside off, and that is superbly done by Ervine, it sat up but he had to swivel well to pull it square, away from the man sprinting from deep midwicket

back of a length, angling into the body. Looks for the quick single after nudging it into the on side. A bit of hesitation, and Kev was quick to the ball to and both he and Williams were diving in the end. Williams to get into his crease, O'Brien to disturb the stumps. It's gone up to the third umpire, it's not out. He's well in.
full-toss outside off, smacked hard past the bowler and Niall O'Brien, sliding to his left from long-off, misfields and deflects the ball into the boundary
full, angling across to off stump, punched to mid-off
full on off stump, this time the push down the ground is a little to mid-off's left, and they can pick up the quick single
full outside off, goes hard at the drive with an angled bat and inside-edges to short fine leg
full outside off, still walks across and tries to help it fine. Doesn't connect. Off his pad and rolls into the leg side
full-toss outside off, slapped to extra cover
full on middle stump, punched down the ground, into the stumps at the other end
full, angling into leg stump, clipped away to square leg, who's right back on the 30-yard circle
tossed up, angling into middle stump, swept to short fine leg
oh my god. Ervine looked to reverse-sweep a middle-stump ball, and popped a simple catch straight to the man at short third man
back of a length, turning into off stump, punched back to the bowler
a bit more flight and he clips it away wide of midwicket, to the right of long-on
full on off stump, driven down to long-on
back of a length, angling into off stump, shuffles across to work it to deep backward square leg
full on middle and off, clipped away to deep midwicket
full outside off, driven away to the right of long-off

oh man, that is a super shot. It's on his pads, yes, but it isn't particularly shot, but he's just half whipped, half pulled it away to the backward square leg boundary, such power. Long leg didn't have a lot of ground to cover
full on off stump, driven to long-on
short outside off, Chakabva jumps across and jabs it away towards third man
length ball outside off, not much flight, whipped down to long-on
down the track, gets inside the line, slaps it down to long-off
tossed up wide outside off, meets it on the pull to drive down to long-off

wow. There wasn't too much flight on that, on off stump, he simply planted his foot forward, next to the line, and swung his hips through a powerful slog-sweep that sends it a large number of rows back over the forward square leg boundary
sweeps straight to short fine leg and they take on the fielder. Chakabva has to dive into the crease to beat the throw home. Williams doesn't collect cleanly, disturbs the stumps with his gloves
very full outside off, looks to dig it out to long-on, short midwicket gets in the way
full on off stump, flat-batted to the left of sweeper cover
slower full-toss outside off, smacked down to long-off
full outside off, driven to mid-off and Chakabva puts in another dive to complete another single
length ball outside off, dabbed away to the right of cover

oh my. I'll struggle to describe this, but I'll try anyway. First he looked to work a straightish ball through the leg side, and it hit him on the thigh pad and rolled into the off side. Cusack turned to appeal, realised it wasn't out, and turned towards the ball again. By this time, it had rolled away from him and they set off for the single. Niall O'Brien comes in from cover and kicks to the bowler's end, misses the stumps, and Chakabva, who had dived into his crease again, picked himself up and the batsmen ran two overthrows
full and wide, slapped to the left of sweeper cover, and they run two

full on middle stump and that is brilliantly done by Chakabva. Gets his front leg out of the way, went down on one knee, and swung it away over midwicket, and into the wide space to the right of long-on, who put in a desperate dive but couldn't stop the boundary
full on middle stump, clipped to deep midwicket, who's just been pushed back to the rope

looks for the yorker, and Williams misses the flick. Pops off the pad into the off side, and Williams had set off for a single. O'Brien quickly chased the ball and flicked it to the keeper's end, with Williams still quite a long way from recovering his crease, and missed the stumps
full on the pads, flicked away to deep square leg

taken! Or is it? That is brilliantly judged by Mooney on the rope. Or is it? It's full on off stump, and Williams clears his front leg to swing it away over the leg side, hits it well, but picks out Mooney at deep midwicket, he catches it over his head, he's leaning back very close to the rope, aaaaaaand, they're checking if he's touched the boundary cushion. Has he? Hasn't he? Is there a bit of movement? Or is it just the shadow of his foot? They're zooming in, and still it looks indecisive. They've given it out, and is it because Williams had already left the ground?
full on middle and leg, clipped towards square leg
slower ball outside off. Comes out of his crease to hit over mid-off, can't connect
full on leg stump, whipped in the air towards deep square leg. Took its while getting to the fielder and they run two
full on middle stump, miscued, but he picked out the gap right behind the bowler, and it drops down well short of long-off rushing in from the boundary

fullish on leg stump, and Panyangara holes out, clears his front leg and goes over the top, doesn't connect nearly as well as he would have liked and long-on comes in from the boundary to take a good low catch
short slower ball outside off, sat up, pulled away to the right of long-on
yorker on middle stump, pushed back to the bowler
now KOB bowls the yorker on middle and leg, and Chakabva clips it towards deep square leg
shot! That's a low full-toss outside off and he steps across his stumps to lap it over short fine leg
full and wide and Mupariwa just flays that away, to the right of cover and that races away to the boundar
and another. Full and wide again, even more width this time, and this time he slices it up over point, but the result is the same
and now he's swung him away for six! It's short, angling into the body, there's a man at deep square leg, but Mupariwa simply clubs him away over that fielder
full on middle stump, swiped down the ground to long-on
and he strikes! Chakabva gets on one knee and looks to swipe across the line from outside off. It's the offcutter, and he inside-edges that into his off stump
full outside off, comes in a bit. Looks to poke it into the off side for a single, inside-edges it towards backward square leg

and he's gone. Ireland have won this. Goes for the big hit over the bowler's head, this was another slower ball, I think, and he didn't get hold of it at all. Got more elevation than distance, and Porterfield, running in from long-on, took it calmly, a captain's catch. Ireland are still in with a definite chance of making the quarterfinals.
